N14/4/PHYSI/SPM/ENG/TZ0/XX




      88146504

Physics
Standard level
Paper 1

Thursday 6 November 2014 (morning)

45 minutes


INSTRUCTIONS TO CANDIDATES

• Do not open this examination paper until instructed to do so.
• Answer all the questions.
• For each question, choose the answer you consider to be the best and indicate your choice
  on the answer sheet provided.
• A clean copy of the Physics Data Booklet is required for this paper.
• The maximum mark for this examination paper is [30 marks].




8814-6504                                                                                           14 pages

                                                 –2–                N14/4/PHYSI/SPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

1.    Which of the following is a fundamental unit?

      A.    Ampere

      B.    Coulomb

      C.    Ohm

      D.    Volt


2.    The maximum acceleration amax of an oscillator undergoing simple harmonic motion (SHM) has a
      percentage uncertainty of 12 %. The amplitude x0 of the oscillation has a percentage uncertainty
                       a
      of 20 %. If k = max what is the percentage uncertainty in the constant k ?
                        x0

      A.    4%

      B.    8%

      C.    16 %

      D.    32 %


3.    An object is dropped from rest above the Earth’s surface. Air resistance acts on the object.
      What is the variation of acceleration a with time t for the object?

      A.    a                                          B.   a




                                   t                                               t


      C.    a                                          D.   a




                                   t                                               t




8814-6504
                                                    –3–                   N14/4/PHYSI/SPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

4.    Which of the following is a condition for an object to be in translational equilibrium?

      A.    The object must be moving at constant speed.

      B.    The velocity of the object in any direction must be zero.

      C.    The forces acting horizontally on the object must equal the forces acting vertically on the object.

      D.    The resultant force acting on the object must be zero.


5.    An object rotates in a horizontal circle when acted on by a centripetal force F. What is the
      centripetal force acting on the object when the radius of the circle doubles and the kinetic energy
      of the object halves?

            F
      A.
            4

            F
      B.
            2

      C.    F

      D.    4F


6.    No external forces act on a given system during an inelastic collision. For this system, which is
      correct about the conservation of kinetic energy and the conservation of linear momentum?

                  Kinetic energy           Linear momentum
      A.         must be conserved          may be conserved

      B.         must be conserved          must be conserved

      C.         is not conserved           may be conserved

      D.         is not conserved           must be conserved




8814-6504                                                                                          Turn over
                                                    –4–               N14/4/PHYSI/SPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

7.    An object of mass m1 has a kinetic energy E1. Another object has a mass m2 and kinetic energy E2.
                                                             E
      The objects have the same momentum. What is the ratio 1 ?
                                                             E2
      A.    1

                m2
      B.
                m1

            m2
      C.
            m1

                     2
             m2 
      D.     
             m1 


8.    A metal sphere is at rest on a bench. According to Newton’s third law of motion, what is a possible
      action-reaction pair for this situation?

                                  Action                                  Reaction
      A.        downwards gravitational force of Earth on      upwards gravitational force of
                the sphere                                     the sphere on Earth

      B.        upwards gravitational force of Earth on the    downwards gravitational force
                sphere                                         of the sphere on Earth

      C.        upwards electrostatic force acting on the      upwards gravitational force of
                sphere due to the atoms in the bench surface   the sphere on Earth

      D.        upwards electrostatic force acting on the      downwards gravitational force
                sphere due to the atoms in the bench surface   of the sphere on Earth




8814-6504
                                                      –5–          N14/4/PHYSI/SPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

9.    Two objects are in thermal contact, initially at different temperatures. Which of the following
      determines the transfer of thermal energy between the objects?

		          I.       The mass of each object
		          II.      The thermal capacity of the objects
		          III.     The temperature of the objects

      A.    I only

      B.    I and II only

      C.    II and III only

      D.    III only


10.   An electrical heating coil of power P is used to transfer thermal energy to a body of mass m.
      In a time t the body changes temperature by ∆θ . What is the thermal capacity of the body?

             Pt
      A.
            m∆θ

              P
      B.
            tm∆θ

            Pt
      C.
            ∆θ

              P
      D.
            t ∆θ




8814-6504                                                                                 Turn over
                                                       –6–                  N14/4/PHYSI/SPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

11.   The following can be determined for a solid substance.

		          I.       The average kinetic energy EKave of the molecules
		          II.      The total kinetic energy EK tot of the molecules
		          III.     The total potential energy EPtot of the molecules

      Which is/are equal to the internal energy of this solid substance?

      A.    I only

      B.    I and III only

      C.    II only

      D.    II and III only


12.   A high solid wall separates two gardens X and Y. Music from a loudspeaker in X can be heard
      in Y even though X cannot be seen from Y. The music can be heard in Y due to

      A.    absorption.

      B.    diffraction.

      C.    reflection.

      D.    refraction.


13.   X and Y are two sources of waves with identical amplitudes and frequencies. Waves from X and Y
      interfere constructively at a detector after travelling the same distance from source to detector.

                                   intensity of the resultant of the two waves
      At the detector, the ratio                                               is
                                           intensity of one wave alone

            1
      A.      .
            2

      B.    1.

      C.    2.

      D.    4.




8814-6504
                                                    –7–                  N14/4/PHYSI/SPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

14.   The natural frequency of vibration of a system

      A.    is the frequency at which it oscillates when it is driven by another system.

      B.    is the frequency at which it oscillates when it is not driven by another system.

      C.    depends on the damping in the system.

      D.    depends on the amplitude of the oscillation of the system.


15.   A particle undergoes simple harmonic motion (SHM) of maximum kinetic energy Emax and
      amplitude x0. The particle is released from rest at its maximum displacement amplitude.
                                                                                               x0
      What is the change in the kinetic energy when the particle has travelled a distance of      ?
                                                                                               3

      A.    Emax
             9

            4 Emax
      B.
               9

            5 Emax
      C.
               9


      D.    8 Emax
               9


16.   A cylindrical resistor of volume V and length l has resistance R. The resistor has a uniform circular
      cross-section. What is the resistivity of the material from which the resistor is made?

            V
      A.
            Rl 2

            V 2R
      B.
              l

            VR
      C.
            l2

            V2
      D.
            Rl

17.   The graph shows the variation of current I with the potential difference V in a device.


                                I

                                                         P
                               Ip




                               0
                                    0                    Vp                     V


      What is the resistance of the device at point P?

            Ip
      A.
            Vp

            Vp
      B.
            Ip

      C.    Gradient of the graph at P

                        1
      D.
            Gradient of the graph at P

18.   A lamp is connected to an electric cell and it lights at its working voltage. The lamp is then
      connected to the same cell in a circuit with an ideal ammeter and an ideal voltmeter. Which circuit
      allows the lamp to light at the original brightness?

      A.                                                   B.




      C.                                                   D.




19.   What is the definition of gravitational field strength at a point?

      A.    Force acting per unit mass on a small mass placed at the point.

      B.    Work done per unit mass on any mass moved to the point.

      C.    Force acting on a small mass placed at the point.

      D.    Work done on any mass moved to the point.




8814-6504                                                                                     Turn over
                                                      – 10 –             N14/4/PHYSI/SPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

20.   A positive point charge P and a negative point charge Q of equal magnitude are held at fixed positions.  
      Y is midway between P and Q.




      Which of the following gives the direction of the electric field due to the charges at X, Y and Z?

                  X             Y             Z
      A.       to right      to left       to right

      B.       to right      to right      to left

      C.       to left       to right      to right

      D.       to left       to right      to left



21.   What field pattern can be produced by two point charges?

      A.                                                   B.




      C.                                                   D.




8814-6504
                                                     – 11 –              N14/4/PHYSI/SPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

22.   Which describes the ionizing ability and the penetrating ability of alpha particles?

               Ionizing ability       Penetrating ability
      A.              low                     high

      B.              high                    low

      C.              low                     low

      D.              high                    high



23.   A student suggests the following nuclear reaction between deuterium 21 H and tritium 31 H
                                              2
                                              1   H + 31 H → nX + mY

      where n and m are integers. What are X and Y?

                      X               Y
      A.       electron            neutron

      B.       electron            proton

      C.       alpha particle      neutron

      D.       alpha particle      proton



24.   In a neutral atom there are ne electrons, np protons and nn neutrons. What is the mass number of
      the nuclide?

      A.    np + ne + nn

      B.    np + nn

      C.    nn + np – ne

      D.    nn – ne




8814-6504                                                                                         Turn over
                                                 – 12 –               N14/4/PHYSI/SPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

25.   Which of the following is true when thermal energy is converted into work in a single process and
      a cyclical process?

                          Single process                             Cyclical process
      A.      complete conversion of thermal energy       energy must be transferred from the
              into work can occur                         system

      B.      complete conversion of thermal energy       energy must be transferred from the
              into work can never occur                   system

      C.      complete conversion of thermal energy       energy need not be transferred from
              into work can occur                         the system

      D.      complete conversion of thermal energy       energy need not be transferred from
              into work can never occur                   the system



26.   What is increased in a sample of uranium ore when nuclear fuel is enriched?

            Number of U-238 atoms
      A.
            Number of U-235 atoms

            Number of U-239 atoms
      B.
            Number of U-238 atoms

            Number of U-235 atoms
      C.
            Number of U-238 atoms

            Number of U-238 atoms
      D.
            Number of U-239 atoms


27.   What is the combination of processes by which a nucleus of plutonium-239 ( 239Pu ) is formed from a
      nucleus of uranium-238 ( 238U )?

      A.    nuclear fission + beta emission

      B.    nuclear fusion + beta emission

      C.    electron capture + beta emission

      D.    neutron capture + beta emission




8814-6504

                                      relative intensity
                                                              T1




                                                                                                  wavelength

      Which graph shows the emission spectrum for the same black body at an absolute temperature T2
      where T2  >  T1? The original graph is shown as a dotted line.

      A.                                                                B.
                                 T2                                                                            T2
            relative intensity




                                                                             relative intensity



                                 T1                                                                     T1




                                                           wavelength                                                 wavelength

      C.                                                                D.
            relative intensity




                                                                             relative intensity




                                 T1                                                                     T1

29.   What is the unit for surface heat capacity?

      A.    N m–2 K–1

      B.    kg m s–2 K–1

      C.    kg s–2 K–1

      D.    N m–3 K–1


30.   The coefficient of volume expansion for sea water is γ . What is the fractional change in the depth of
      the ocean when its temperature changes by 1 K and its area remains constant?
            γ
      A.
            3

      B.    γ

      C.    3γ

      D.    3   γ
